index.head: A PRACTICAL EXAMPLE...
index.screenText: A culture of bacteria contains 1g bacteria when you start the culture at time t = 0 and the culture grows in such a way that the mass doubles every hour.

Note: This situation is satisfactorily represented by the equation y = 2x and by the plot (a) in the graph. Here, y is the mass of bacteria in grams and x is the time in hours. The base 2 represents the fact that y is doubled in every hour.

This equation can be used to estimate the mass of bacteria after any time <font face="times_new_romanbold_italic">x</font>, whether <font face="times_new_romanbold_italic">x</font> is an integer or a fractional part of an hour such as <font face="times_new_romanbold_italic">x</font> = 1.5h, 3.1h.
